newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Goldtron profit hit by soft electronics.
newsitem.headline: Goldtron profit hit by soft electronics.

text.p: Electronics company Goldtron Ltd said on Friday its 45 percent drop in profits for the first half of 1996 was due to the general softening of the electronics industry and keen competition.
The group reported profits for the half year ended June 30 fell 45 percent to Singapore $7.44 million from S$13.43 million in the same period of the previous year.

"The weakness in the electronics industry coupled with keen competition contributed to the erosion of margins of the group's main business when compared to the same period last year," the company said in its interim results.
It said the reorganisation which started last year to allow the group to concentrate on its core businesses in telecommunications and electronics resulted in an extraordinary loss of S$2.57 million.
